title: Woman before an Aquarium

thumbnail.alt_text: Painting of woman, arms crossed on brown desk, staring at goldfish.

description: In the first two decades of the 20th century, Henri Matisse visited exhibitions of Islamic art and traveled to Algeria and Morocco, where he collected pottery, textiles, and tiles. Years later while living in Nice, France, Matisse reflected on these experiences, integrating visual elements he encountered, such as the patterned textile screen, into his paintings. In Woman before an Aquarium, the carefully subdued decorative pattern of the screen contributes to the psychologically rich, contemplative mood of this interior scene.
publication_history: W. A. P., “Modern French Paintings: The Birch-Bartlett Collection,” Bulletin of the Art Institute of Chicago 17, no. 7 (Oct. 1923), p. 71, as Girl with Fishbowl. Art Institute of Chicago, Group of Modern Paintings from the Birch-Bartlett Collection, Sept. 8–Oct. 22, 1923, no cat.

Art Institute of Chicago, “A Century of Progress”: Exhibition of Paintings and Sculpture for 1934, June 1–Nov. 1, 1934, cat. 352, as Woman before an Aquarium, 1921.

Art Institute of Chicago, Masterpiece of the Month: Woman before an Aquarium by Henri Matisse, Sept. 1950, no cat.

New York, Museum of Modern Art, Henri Matisse, Nov. 13, 1951–Jan. 13, 1952, cat. 54, as Woman before an Aquarium, (1921); Cleveland Museum of Art, Feb. 5– Mar. 16, 1952; Art Institute of Chicago, Apr. 1–May 4, 1952; San Francisco Museum of Art, May 22–July 6, 1952.

Paris, Musée national d’art moderne, Rétrospective Henri Matisse, July 28–Nov. 18, 1956, cat. 63 (ill.), as Femme devant un Aquarium, 1921.

New York, Museum of Modern Art, Henri Matisse: A Retrospective, Sept. 24, 1992–Jan. 12, 1993, pl. 255, as Woman Before an Aquarium/Femme devant un aquarium, [late1921 or 1923].

Zurich, Kunsthaus, Max Beckmann und Paris: Matisse, Picasso, Braque, Léger, Rouault, Sept. 25, 1998–Jan. 3, 1999, cat. 83 (ill.), as Frau vor einem Aquarium/Femme devant un aquarium, 1921/23; Saint Louis Art Museum [as Max Beckmann and Paris: Matisse, Picasso, Braque, Léger, Rouault], Feb. 6–May 9, 1999, as Woman Before a Fish Bowl, 1921/23.

Düsseldorf, K20 Kunstsammlung Nordrhein-Westfalen, Henri Matisse: Figur, Farbe, Raum, Oct. 29, 2005–Feb. 19, 2006, cat. 115 (ill.), as Femme devant un aquarium/Frau mit Goldfischen, 1921–1923; Basel, Foundation Beyeler, Mar. 19–July 9, 2006.

Fort Worth, Kimbell Art Museum, The Age of Picasso and Matisse: Modern Masters from the Art Institute of Chicago, Oct. 6, 2013–Feb. 16, 2014, no cat. no. (ill.), as Woman before an Aquarium, 1921–23.
provenance_text: The artist; sold to Bernheim-Jeune, Paris, June 12, 1923 [this and the following according to Dauberville 1995]; sold for 11,200 francs to Frederick Clay Bartlett (1873–1953), Chicago, June 14, 1923; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, Jan. 27, 1926.
